intro: Lappula tianschanica var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender lappula, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
